ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མ་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པའི་སྙིང་པོ [Type: ParallelScene | Desc: "The complete title of the Heart Sutra text" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མ [Type: State | Desc: "State that identifies the embodiment of the Heart of Perfection of Wisdom" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the heart/essence, specifying what kind of heart/essence it is" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཤེས་རབ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on what kind of perfection is being referred to" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པའི [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept being elaborated upon by 'wisdom'" | Implicit: ""]
    └── སྙིང་པོ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept of the title - the heart or essence of the Perfection of Wisdom" | Implicit: ""]
word_by_word:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མ་ : Blessed Lady [Honorific title; compound of `བཅོམ་`: conquered, `ལྡན་`: possessing, `འདས་`: transcended, and feminine marker `མ་`; refers to the female embodiment of perfected wisdom; functions as the main referent in the title]

- ཤེས་རབ་ : wisdom [Noun; `ཤེས་`: to know + `རབ་`: supreme; refers to transcendent wisdom or prajñā; elaborates on the type of perfection being referenced]

- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle connecting `ཤེས་རབ་` with the subsequent phrase; marks possessive relationship]

- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : to the other shore [Locative construction; `ཕ་རོལ་`: other side/shore + `ཏུ་`: directional particle; metaphorical expression for transcendence or going beyond; part of the compound term for "perfection"]

- ཕྱིན་པའི་ : perfection [Nominalized verb with genitive; from `ཕྱིན་པ་`: to go/reach + genitive `འི་`; literally "having gone to"; forms "perfection of wisdom" (prajñāpāramitā) with previous elements; functions as a modifier of `སྙིང་པོ`]

- སྙིང་པོ : heart/essence [Noun; core, heart, essence; refers to the distilled or essential teaching; functions as the central concept of the title]

ucca_formatted:
༄༅། །​རྒྱ་གར་སྐད་དུ། བྷ་ག་བ་ཏི་པྲ་ཛྙ་པ་ར་མི་ཏཱྀ་ཧྲད་ཡ། [Type: ParallelScene | Desc: "root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རྒྱ་གར་སྐད་དུ། [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "context_setting" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྷ་ག་བ་ཏི་པྲ་ཛྙ་པ་ར་མི་ཏཱྀ་ཧྲད་ཡ། [Type: Center | Desc: "title" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྷ་ག་བ་ཏི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "title_component" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── པྲ་ཛྙ་པ་ར་མི་ཏཱྀ [Type: Center | Desc: "title_component" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཧྲད་ཡ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "title_component" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ༄༅། ། [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "ornamental_marker" | Implicit: ""]
word_by_word:
- ༄༅། ། : auspicious marks [Ornamental markers that typically appear at the beginning of Tibetan texts; these symbols serve as decorative elements that indicate the start of a sacred text; functions as an ornamental marker in the text structure]

- རྒྱ་གར་ : Indian [Noun referring to India/भारत; serves as the first part of the adverbial phrase setting the linguistic context]

- སྐད་ : language [Noun meaning 'language, speech'; combines with རྒྱ་གར་ to form 'Indian language' or 'Sanskrit']

- དུ། : in [Terminative case marker indicating 'in' or 'into'; completes the adverbial phrase 'in the Indian language'; functions as part of the context-setting element]

- བྷ་ག་བ་ཏི་ : Bhagavatī [Sanskrit term transliterated into Tibetan; feminine form meaning 'Blessed One, Divine Lady'; first component of the Sanskrit title; functions as an elaborator of the main title]

- པྲ་ཛྙ་པ་ར་མི་ཏཱྀ་ : Prajñāpāramitā [Sanskrit term transliterated into Tibetan; meaning 'Perfection of Wisdom'; central component of the title referring to the Perfection of Wisdom literature; serves as the center or main element of the title]

- ཧྲད་ཡ : Hṛdaya [Sanskrit term transliterated into Tibetan; meaning 'heart, essence, core'; final component of the title indicating this is the 'Heart' or essence of the Prajñāpāramitā; functions as an elaborator qualifying the main title]

ucca_formatted:
བོད་སྐད་དུ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མ་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པའི་སྙིང་པོ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the title phrase" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བོད་སྐད་དུ། [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial phrase indicating the language of the text" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མ་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པའི་སྙིང་པོ། [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The title phrase of the text" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མ་ [Type: Center | Desc: "The possessor - refers to the female Buddha figure" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པའི་སྙིང་པོ། [Type: Possession | Desc: "The possessed item - refers to the Buddhist text" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པའི་ [Type: Center | Desc: "Descriptor of the text type" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ [Type: Center | Desc: "Object of the function - wisdom" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པའི་ [Type: Function | Desc: "Functional concept in Buddhist philosophy - the act of perfecting or transcending" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྙིང་པོ། [Type: Center | Desc: "Core or essence of the text" | Implicit: ""]
word_by_word:
- བོད་སྐད་དུ། : In Tibetan language [Terminative case marker དུ with བོད་སྐད་ (Tibetan language); indicates the language in which the title is presented; functions as an Adverbial modifier specifying the linguistic context]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མ་ : Bhagavatī [Feminine form of བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ (Bhagavān/Buddha); literally "the female transcendent victor"; functions as the possessor in the possessive construction; refers to the female Buddha figure]

- ཤེས་རབ་ : wisdom [Root noun ཤེས་རབ་ (prajñā); refers to transcendent wisdom or insight; functions as the object being perfected in the Buddhist philosophical context]

- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle connecting ཤེས་རབ་ to ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་; indicates possessive relationship; marks wisdom as the object of perfection]

- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : to the other shore [ཕ་རོལ་ (other side/shore) with terminative particle ཏུ; part of the compound term for "perfection"; indicates the destination or goal of transcendence]

- ཕྱིན་པའི་ : gone/perfection [Perfect form of འགྲོ་བ་ (to go) with genitive འི་; combines with ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ to form "pāramitā" (perfection/transcendence); indicates the act of crossing over to wisdom's far shore]

- སྙིང་པོ། : heart essence [Root noun སྙིང་པོ་ (heart/essence/hṛdaya); refers to the distilled, essential teaching; functions as the core element of the title phrase, indicating this is the condensed version of the larger text]

བམ་པོ་གཅིག་གོ ། [Type: State | Desc: "Root node representing the state 'this is section one'" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བམ་པོ་ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept 'bampo' (section/volume)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གཅིག་ [Type: Elaborator-Quantity | Desc: "Quantity modifier specifying the number of the section" | Implicit: ""]
    └── གོ ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Grammatical marker indicating end of statement" | Implicit: ""]
word_by_word:
- བམ་པོ་ : section [Noun: `བམ་པོ་`: a division/section of a text or manuscript; functions as the central concept in this phrase]
- གཅིག་ : one [Number: `གཅིག་`: the numeral one; here modifying བམ་པོ་ to specify which section; functions as a quantity modifier]
- གོ ། : is [Final particle: `གོ`: sentence-final particle indicating completion or declaration; here marking the end of the statement "This is section one"; functions as a grammatical marker that completes the statement]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མ་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་དུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ལ་ཕྱག་འཚལ་ལོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node for the homage verse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Practitioner/Author] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit practitioner or author making the homage, as conventional in Tibetan Buddhist texts" | Implicit: "The implicit practitioner or author making the homage, as conventional in Tibetan Buddhist texts"]
    ├── ཕྱག་འཚལ་ལོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of paying homage or prostrating" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མ་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་དུ་ཕྱིན་པ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of the homage" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central entity who embodies the Perfection of Wisdom" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཤེས་རབ [Type: State | Desc: "The concept of wisdom as a quality or state associated with the Blessed Mother" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་དུ་ཕྱིན་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Description of the transcendent nature of wisdom" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཀྱི [Type: Relator | Desc: "Genitive particle connecting wisdom with its perfection" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཕ་རོལ་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Indicates the transcendent nature or 'beyond-ness'" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཕྱིན་པ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of having gone beyond or reached perfection" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ལ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relator connecting the process to the recipient" | Implicit: ""]
word_by_word:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མ་ : Blessed Mother [Honorific title; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), `འདས་` (transcended), and `མ་` (feminine marker); refers to the female embodiment of the Perfection of Wisdom; functions as the central recipient of homage]

- ཤེས་རབ་ : wisdom [Noun; refers to transcendent wisdom or prajñā; here specifically refers to the quality or state associated with the Blessed Mother; serves as the primary attribute of the recipient]

- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; connects `ཤེས་རབ་` (wisdom) with its perfection; functions as a relator linking wisdom to its transcendent quality]

- ཕ་རོལ་དུ་ : beyond [Adverbial phrase; `ཕ་རོལ་` (other shore/side) + `དུ་` (terminative/locative particle); indicates transcendence or crossing to the furthest point; expresses the "beyond-ness" nature]

- ཕྱིན་པ་ : perfection/gone [Verbal noun from `ཕྱིན་` (to go/reach); literally "having gone"; here refers to the state of having reached perfection or transcendence; completes the term "Perfection of Wisdom" (prajñāpāramitā)]

- ལ་ : to [Dative/locative particle; connects the recipient of homage with the act of prostration; functions as a relator indicating the object toward which reverence is directed]

- ཕྱག་འཚལ་ : prostrate/pay homage [Verb; `ཕྱག་` (honorific for hand/prostration) + `འཚལ་` (to offer); indicates the devotional action being performed by the implicit practitioner; functions as the main process in the sentence]

- ལོ : [Final particle; marks the end of a declarative statement with a slight emphatic quality; completes the act of homage]

ucca_formatted:
འདི་སྐད་བདག་གིས་ཐོས་པ་དུས་གཅིག་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བདག་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is doing the hearing" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཐོས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of hearing" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་སྐད [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Describes the manner of hearing rather than being a direct patient" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དུས་གཅིག་ན [Type: Adverbial-Time | Desc: "Temporal adverbial expression indicating when the hearing occurred" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གཅིག [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantifier for the time expression" | Implicit: ""]
word_by_word:
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; indicating proximity; specifies the words that follow as the thing that was heard; functions as a determiner]
- སྐད་ : speech/words [Noun; refers to spoken language or communication; object of what was heard; part of the elaborator indicating manner]
- བདག་ : I/me [First-person pronoun; refers to the narrator/speaker; the Agent who performs the hearing in the semantic structure]
- གིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates བདག་ is the doer/agent of the action; marks the Agent participant]
- ཐོས་པ་ : heard [Verb; root `ཐོས་`: to hear; past tense form indicating the completed action of hearing; the main Process of the sentence]
- དུས་ : time [Noun; temporal reference; forms part of the temporal adverbial expression]
- གཅིག་ : one/a certain [Numeral functioning as indefinite article; quantifier for time; indicates a specific but unidentified instance]
- ན : at/in/on [Locative particle; indicates time when something happened; completes the temporal adverbial phrase]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་རྒྱལ་པོའི་ཁབ་བྱ་རྒོད་ཕུང་པོའི་རི་ལ་དགེ་སློང་གི་དགེ་འདུན་ཆེན་པོ་དང་། ​བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་དགེ་འདུན་ཆེན་པོ་དང་ཐབས་ཅིག་ཏུ་བཞུགས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing the Buddha residing at a location with accompanying assemblies" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The main agent of the scene (the Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རྒྱལ་པོའི་ཁབ་བྱ་རྒོད་ཕུང་པོའི་རི་ལ [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "The location where the Buddha is residing, split into city and mountain" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རྒྱལ་པོའི་ཁབ [Type: Center | Desc: "The city where the Buddha is residing" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བྱ་རྒོད་ཕུང་པོའི་རི་ལ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The specific mountain location within Rajagriha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཞུགས་ཏེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of the scene" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དགེ་སློང་གི་དགེ་འདུན་ཆེན་པོ་དང་། ​བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་དགེ་འདུན་ཆེན་པོ་དང་ཐབས་ཅིག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Accompanier | Desc: "Parent node for the two assemblies that accompany the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དགེ་སློང་གི་དགེ་འདུན་ཆེན་པོ་དང་ [Type: Participant-Accompanier | Desc: "The first assembly accompanying the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དགེ་སློང་གི [Type: Center | Desc: "Specifies the type of the first assembly" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཆེན་པོ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Describes the size or importance of the first assembly" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་དགེ་འདུན་ཆེན་པོ་དང [Type: Participant-Accompanier | Desc: "The second assembly accompanying the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི [Type: Center | Desc: "Specifies the type of assembly" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཆེན་པོ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Describes the size or importance of the assembly" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཐབས་ཅིག་ཏུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifies the accompanying relationship between the Buddha and the assemblies" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ། [Type: Ground | Desc: "Sentence-final punctuation mark" | Implicit: ""]
word_by_word:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས : The Blessed One [Epithet of the Buddha; compound of བཅོམ 'conquered' + ལྡན 'possessing' + འདས 'transcended'; referring to one who has conquered defilements, possesses qualities, and transcended samsara; functions as the main Agent of the scene]

- རྒྱལ་པོའི་ : king's [Genitive of རྒྱལ་པོ་ 'king'; used here as a possessive modifier of the following location; part of a locative phrase describing where the Buddha resided]

- ཁབ་ : Rajagriha [Proper noun; name of the capital city of ancient Magadha kingdom; literally 'needle'; functions as the main part of the location reference]

- བྱ་རྒོད་ : vulture [Compound noun; referring to a specific type of bird; modifies the following word to form the mountain name]

- ཕུང་པོའི་ : heap of [Genitive of ཕུང་པོ་ 'heap, aggregate, pile'; used as a descriptor for the mountain; part of the compound name of the location]

- རི་ : mountain [Noun; natural elevated landform; the specific location where the Buddha resided]

- ལ་ : at, on [Locative particle; indicates the location where the action takes place; connects the location to the main verb]

- དགེ་སློང་ : monks [Noun; fully ordained Buddhist monastics; literally 'virtue beggar'; the type of the first assembly accompanying the Buddha]

- གི་ : of [Genitive particle; shows possessive relationship; connects 'monks' to 'assembly']

- དགེ་འདུན་ : assembly, sangha [Noun; formal community of Buddhist practitioners; here referring to the monastic community]

- ཆེན་པོ་ : great [Adjective; large in size or importance; describes the assembly as being large in number or significance]

- སྨྲས་སོ། : spoke [Past tense of སྨྲ་བ་ 'to speak, say'; with final particle སོ་ indicating completion; the main Process verb of the sentence]

རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་གང་ལ་ལ་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ཟབ་མོའི་སྤྱོད་པ་སྤྱད་པར་འདོད་པ་དེས་ཇི་ལྟར་བསླབ་པར་བྱ། དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་སྨྲས་པ་དང་། བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་འཕགས་པ་སྤྱན་རས་གཟིགས་དབང་ཕྱུག་གིས་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ཤཱ་ར་དྭ་ཏའི་བུ་ལ་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་སྨྲས་སོ། །​ཤཱ་རིའི་བུ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ། རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་ལ་ལ་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ཟབ་མོའི་སྤྱོད་པ་སྤྱད་པར་འདོད་པ་དེས་འདི་ལྟར་རྣམ་པར་བལྟ་བར་བྱ་སྟེ། ​ཕུང་པོ་ལྔ་པོ་དེ་དག་ཀྱང་རང་བཞིན་གྱིས་སྟོང་པར་རྣམ་པར་ཡང་དག་པར་རྗེས་སུ་བལྟའོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing three main scenes from the Heart Sutra text" | Implicit: ""]

word_by_word:
# Tibetan Text Glossary

- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་ : noble son [Noun phrase; combines `རིགས་`: lineage/noble family + `ཀྱི་`: genitive particle + `བུ་`: son; refers to a spiritual practitioner of good family lineage; functions as the primary addressee]

- གང་ལ་ལ་ : whoever, anyone [Indefinite pronoun; from `གང་`: which/who + reduplicative particle `ལ་ལ་`: some/any; indicates any member of the category mentioned; serves as a quantifier modifying the preceding noun]

- ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ : of wisdom [Genitive construction; `ཤེས་རབ་`: wisdom/insight/prajñā + `ཀྱི་`: genitive particle; indicates the type of perfection being discussed; modifies the following noun]

- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : to the other shore [Terminative construction; `ཕ་རོལ་`: other side/shore + `ཏུ་`: terminative particle; part of the term for "perfection" (pāramitā); metaphorically indicates complete transcendence]

- ཕྱིན་པ་ : perfection [Verbal noun; from `ཕྱིན་`: gone/reached + nominalizer `པ་`; combined with previous term forms "perfection of wisdom" (prajñāpāramitā); functions as the object of practice]

- ཟབ་མོའི་ : profound [Genitive adjective; `ཟབ་མོ་`: profound/deep + genitive `འི་`; qualifies the practice as being profound or deep; describes the spiritual depth of the practice]

- སྤྱོད་པ་ : practice [Verbal noun; from `སྤྱོད་`: to practice/conduct + nominalizer `པ་`; refers to the spiritual conduct or practice; functions as the object being practiced]

- སྤྱད་པར་ : to practice [Future/purpose construction; `སྤྱད་`: practice (future stem) + purposive `པར་`; indicates the intended activity; forms part of verb phrase]

- འདོད་པ་ : wishes [Verbal noun; from `འདོད་`: to desire/wish + nominalizer `པ་`; indicates the practitioner's aspiration; functions as the verbal process of desiring]

- དེས་ : by that one [Instrumental pronoun; `དེ་`: that + instrumental `ས་`; refers back to the person who wishes to practice; functions as agent marker]

- ཇི་ལྟར་ : how [Interrogative adverb; lit. "in what manner"; introduces the question about method; functions as interrogative particle]

- བསླབ་པར་ : to train [Future verbal construction; `བསླབ་`: train/learn (future) + purposive `པར་`; indicates what should be done; forms part of verb phrase]

- བྱ། : should do [Final verb; auxiliary indicating obligation; completes the question "how should one train?"; functions as the main predicate]

- དེ་སྐད་ : thus, in this way [Demonstrative phrase; `དེ་`: that + `སྐད་`: speech/words; refers to the preceding statement; functions as patient of speaking]

- ཅེས་ : that [Quotative particle; marks quoted speech or thought; connects speech content to verb]

- སྨྲས་པ་ : having spoken [Past verbal noun; `སྨྲས་`: spoke (past) + nominalizer `པ་`; indicates the completed action of speaking; functions as process]

- དང་། : and [Conjunction; connects the previous statement with what follows; functions as connector between scenes]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Compound noun; `བྱང་ཆུབ་`: enlightenment + `སེམས་དཔའ་`: hero/warrior of mind; refers to enlightenment-seeking being; functions as part of agent of speaking]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་ : great being [Noun phrase; `སེམས་དཔའ་`: mind-hero + `ཆེན་པོ་`: great; honorific title; functions as further qualification of the bodhisattva]

- འཕགས་པ་ : noble [Honorific adjective; lit. "exalted one"; title of respect; further qualifies the bodhisattva]

- སྤྱན་རས་གཟིགས་ : Avalokiteshvara [Proper name; lit. "One who looks with compassionate eyes"; the bodhisattva of compassion; functions as the primary agent]

- དབང་ཕྱུག་ : lord [Honorific title; lit. "powerful master"; final epithet for Avalokiteshvara; completes the agent identification]

- གིས་ : by [Instrumental particle; marks the agent of the action; connects agent to verb]

- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : venerable [Honorific phrase; `ཚེ་`: life + `དང་`: and + `ལྡན་པ་`: possessing; traditional epithet for monastics; functions as honorific address]

- ཤཱ་ར་དྭ་ཏའི་བུ་ : Shariputra [Proper name; `ཤཱ་ར་དྭ་ཏའི་`: Sharadwati's + `བུ་`: son; Sanskrit name of Buddha's disciple; functions as recipient of speech]

- ལ་ : to [Dative particle; marks the recipient of speech; connects recipient to verb]

- འདི་སྐད་ : these words [Demonstrative phrase; `འདི་`: this + `སྐད་`: speech; introduces direct speech; functions as patient of speaking]

- སྨྲས་སོ། : spoke [Past verb + final particle; `སྨྲས་`: spoke (past) + final `སོ་`; indicates completed speech; functions as main process]

- ཤཱ་རིའི་བུ་ : Shariputra [Proper name; alternative form; `ཤཱ་རིའི་`: Shari's + `བུ་`: son; vocative address; functions as recipient of instruction]

- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ། : or a son of noble family [Noun phrase + disjunctive; `རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་`: noble son + `འམ་`: or; indicates alternative address; functions as part of agent]

- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་ : daughter of noble family [Noun phrase; `རིགས་ཀྱི་`: of noble family + `བུ་མོ་`: daughter; female counterpart to previous term; functions as part of agent]

- འདི་ལྟར་ : in this way [Demonstrative adverb; `འདི་`: this + `ལྟར་`: like/as; introduces method of practice; functions as adverbial]

- རྣམ་པར་ : thoroughly [Intensifying adverb; emphasizes completeness of action; modifies the following verb]

- བལྟ་བར་ : to observe [Future verbal construction; `བལྟ་`: look/observe (future) + purposive `བར་`; indicates contemplative examination; forms part of verb phrase]

- བྱ་སྟེ། : should do [Verb + connective; `བྱ་`: should do (future) + `སྟེ་`: connective particle; indicates obligation and connects to further explanation; functions as process marker]

- ཕུང་པོ་ : aggregates [Noun; Sanskrit "skandha"; refers to the five components constituting a person; functions as the object of observation]

- ལྔ་པོ་ : five [Numeral + definite marker; `ལྔ་`: five + `པོ་`: definite marker; specifies the exact number of aggregates; functions as quantifier]

- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural; `དེ་`: that + `དག་`: plural marker; refers to previously mentioned aggregates; functions as patient]

- ཀྱང་ : also [Emphatic particle; indicates inclusion or addition; emphasizes that even the aggregates are empty]

- རང་བཞིན་གྱིས་ : by nature [Adverbial phrase; `རང་བཞིན་`: inherent nature + instrumental `གྱིས་`; indicates the inherent quality being discussed; functions as adverbial]

- སྟོང་པར་ : as empty [Adverbial construction; `སྟོང་པ་`: empty + purposive `ར་`; central philosophical concept of emptiness (śūnyatā); describes how to view aggregates]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly, correctly [Adverbial phrase; `ཡང་དག་པ་`: correct/perfect + purposive `ར་`; indicates thoroughness and correctness; qualifies the observation]

- རྗེས་སུ་ : thoroughly [Adverbial prefix; intensifies the following verb; indicates complete immersion in the activity]

- བལྟའོ། : should observe [Final verb; `བལྟ་`: observe (future) + final particle `འོ་`; main instruction of how to practice wisdom; functions as main predicate]

word_by_word:
- གཟུགས་ : Form [Noun, Sanskrit: rūpa; refers to material/physical phenomena; functions as the Subject/Participant in first statement]
- སྟོང་པའོ : is empty [Predicative state marker `འོ་` added to `སྟོང་པ་`: emptiness; declarative ending asserting the state of emptiness; serves as predicate/state in first statement]
- ། : [Tibetan shad punctuation mark; serves as sentence terminator and linker between parallel philosophical statements]
- སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་ : Emptiness [Noun, Sanskrit: śūnyatā; philosophical term denoting the lack of inherent existence; `ཉིད་` emphasizes the abstract quality; functions as Subject/Participant in second statement]
- གཟུགས་སོ : is form [Predicative state marker `སོ་` added to `གཟུགས་`: form; declarative ending asserting identity; serves as predicate/state in second statement]
- ། : [Tibetan shad punctuation mark; sentence terminator]

སེམས་ཅན་ཐམས་ཅད་བདེ་བ་དང་བདེ་བའི་རྒྱུ་དང་ལྡན་པར་གྱུར་ཅིག [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire prayer/aspiration" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས་ཅན་ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The entities who are to possess the attributes" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན [Type: Center | Desc: "Core referring expression for living beings" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantifier indicating all sentient beings without exception" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལྡན་པར་གྱུར་ཅིག [Type: Process-State | Desc: "Optative/benedictive expression indicating both a process and a desired state" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལྡན་པར [Type: Center | Desc: "Main part of the verb phrase indicating possession/endowment" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གྱུར་ཅིག [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Optative marker expressing wish or benediction" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བདེ་བ་དང་བདེ་བའི་རྒྱུ་དང [Type: State-Attribute | Desc: "The qualities or states that sentient beings should possess" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདེ་བ [Type: Center | Desc: "First element in the coordinated structure - the state of happiness" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking the first and second elements in the coordination" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདེ་བའི་རྒྱུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Second element in the coordinated structure - the causes leading to happiness" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བདེ་བའི [Type: Relator | Desc: "Genitive modifier specifying what kind of causes" | Implicit: ""]
            └── རྒྱུ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept of causes/conditions" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Final conjunction in the coordinated structure, indicating possible continuation of the prayer" | Implicit: ""]
word_by_word:
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Noun; root word meaning consciousness/mind with the -can suffix forming an agent noun; refers to all living beings capable of consciousness; functions as Patient participant in the prayer]

- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Universal quantifier; from ཐམས་ + ཅད་ meaning "complete, entire, without exception"; modifies སེམས་ཅན་ to include all sentient beings without exception; serves as Quantity modifier]

- བདེ་བ་ : happiness [Noun; from root བདེ་ meaning "well-being, bliss"; the primary state being wished for sentient beings; functions as the first attribute in a coordinated structure]

- དང་ : and [Conjunction; links the two qualities being wished for; connects "happiness" with "causes of happiness"]

- བདེ་བའི་ : of happiness [Genitive form of བདེ་བ་; functions as a modifier specifying what kind of causes are being referenced; links happiness to its causes]

- རྒྱུ་ : causes [Noun; referring to conditions, factors, or circumstances that bring about happiness; the second main element being wished for]

- དང་ : and [Conjunction; marks the end of the coordinated structure in this prayer formula; indicates potential continuation of the prayer]

- ལྡན་པར་ : possess, be endowed with [Verbal noun with terminative case; from root ལྡན་པ་ meaning "to have, to possess"; central verbal concept indicating the state of being endowed with the previously mentioned qualities]

- གྱུར་ཅིག་ : may they become [Optative form; གྱུར་ from འགྱུར་བ་ "to become, transform" + ཅིག་ optative particle; expresses the aspiration or benediction; functions as modal marker conveying the wish/prayer aspect]

    ├── གཟུགས་ལས་སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་གཞན་མ་ཡིན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First statement expressing non-difference between form and emptiness" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གཟུགས་ལས [Type: Participant-Topic | Desc: "Topic of first statement with ablative case marker indicating reference point" | Implicit: ""]

    └── སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་ལས་ཀྱང་གཟུགས་གཞན་མ་ཡིན་ནོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second statement expressing non-difference between emptiness and form" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་ལས་ཀྱང [Type: Participant-Topic | Desc: "Topic of second statement including particle ཀྱང (also) creating parallel structure" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གཟུགས [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "Central concept being equated with emptiness in second statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གཞན [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial modifier indicating relationship between emptiness and form" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མ་ཡིན [Type: State | Desc: "Negative state marker in second statement" | Implicit: ""]

word_by_word:
- གཟུགས་ལས་ : from form [Ablative case of `གཟུགས་`: form, rūpa; functions as reference point establishing comparison; serves as Topic in first statement]
- སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་ : emptiness [Noun `སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་`: śūnyatā, emptiness; central philosophical concept in Buddhism being equated with form; functions as central participant]
- གཞན་ : different [Adjective `གཞན་`: other, different; here indicates relationship being negated between form and emptiness; functions as adverbial modifier]
- མ་ཡིན། : is not [Negative copula `མ་ཡིན་`: is not; negative state marker completing first statement; indicates non-difference]
- སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་ལས་ : from emptiness [Ablative case of `སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་`: emptiness, śūnyatā; functions as reference point for comparison in second statement; serves as Topic]
- ཀྱང་ : also [Particle `ཀྱང་`: also, too; creates parallel structure with first statement; strengthens the bidirectional equivalence]
- གཟུགས་ : form [Noun `གཟུགས་`: form, rūpa; central philosophical concept in Buddhism being equated with emptiness; functions as central participant]
- གཞན་ : different [Adjective `གཞན་`: other, different; here indicates relationship being negated between emptiness and form; functions as adverbial modifier]
- མ་ཡིན་ནོ། : is not [Negative copula `མ་ཡིན་` + sentence-final particle `ནོ`: is not; negative state marker with emphatic particle; indicates non-difference]
- ། ། : [Final punctuation mark indicating end of complete statement or verse]

​དེ་བཞིན་དུ་ཚོར་བ་དང་། ​འདུ་ཤེས་དང་། འདུ་བྱེད་དང་། རྣམ་པར་ཤེས་པ་རྣམས་སྟོང་པའོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་དུ་ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Discourse connector indicating similarity to previous statement" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཚོར་བ་དང་། ​འདུ་ཤེས་དང་། འདུ་བྱེད་དང་། རྣམ་པར་ཤེས་པ་རྣམས་སྟོང་པའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing the emptiness of aggregates" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཚོར་བ་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "First aggregate - feelings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདུ་ཤེས་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Second aggregate - perceptions" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདུ་བྱེད་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Third aggregate - formations" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རྣམ་པར་ཤེས་པ་རྣམས་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Fourth aggregate - consciousnesses with pluralizer" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྟོང་པའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Main predication - being empty" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དང་། [Type: Function | Desc: "Connective coordinating the list of aggregates" | Implicit: ""]
word_by_word:
- དེ་བཞིན་དུ་ : likewise [Adverbial phrase; compound of `དེ་` (that) + `བཞིན་` (like, manner) + `དུ་` (terminative case marker); functions as a discourse connector indicating similarity to previous statements; signals that what follows applies in the same way as previously discussed concepts]

- ཚོར་བ་ : feeling [Noun; one of the five aggregates (skandhas) in Buddhist philosophy; refers to sensations or feelings that arise from contact between sense organs and objects; functions as a Patient participant in the emptiness assertion]

- དང་། : and [Conjunction particle; connects items in a list; here coordinating the enumeration of aggregates as parallel participants]

- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun; one of the five aggregates (skandhas); refers to recognition, discernment, or conceptual identification of objects; functions as a Patient participant in the emptiness assertion]

- དང་། : and [Conjunction particle; connects items in a list; here coordinating the enumeration of aggregates as parallel participants]

- འདུ་བྱེད་ : formations [Noun; one of the five aggregates (skandhas); refers to volitional activities, mental formations, or karmic constructs; functions as a Patient participant in the emptiness assertion]

- དང་། : and [Conjunction particle; connects items in a list; here coordinating the enumeration of aggregates as parallel participants]

- རྣམ་པར་ཤེས་པ་ : consciousness [Noun; from `རྣམ་པར་` (completely, thoroughly) + `ཤེས་པ་` (to know, consciousness); one of the five aggregates (skandhas); refers to the six types of consciousness arising from contact between sense faculties and objects]

- རྣམས་ : all [Pluralizer; indicates plurality of the preceding nouns; here emphasizing all aspects or instances of consciousness; modifies all the aggregates in the list]

- སྟོང་པའོ། ། : are empty [Verb phrase; `སྟོང་པ་` (empty) + `འོ` (final particle indicating assertion or declaration); the main predication asserting the emptiness (śūnyatā) of all the listed aggregates; functions as the main Process in the sentence]

​ཤཱ་རིའི་བུ་དེ་ལྟ་བས་ན་ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་དེ། མཚན་ཉིད་མེད་པ། མ་སྐྱེས་པ། ​མ་འགགས་པ། དྲི་མ་མེད་པ། དྲི་མ་དང་བྲལ་བ་མེད་པ། ​བྲི་བ་མེད་པ། གང་བ་མེད་པའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The root scene containing the complete statement about all phenomena being empty and having other qualities" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ​ཤཱ་རིའི་བུ [Type: Addressee | Desc: "The person being addressed in this statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ལྟ་བས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "The connector that links this statement to previous context" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "The central topic being described" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── are [Type: Process | Desc: "Implied process connecting phenomena with their qualities" | Implicit: "Process connecting phenomena with their qualities"]
    └── སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་དེ། མཚན་ཉིད་མེད་པ། མ་སྐྱེས་པ། ​མ་འགགས་པ། དྲི་མ་མེད་པ། དྲི་མ་དང་བྲལ་བ་མེད་པ། ​བྲི་བ་མེད་པ། གང་བ་མེད་པའོ། ། [Type: State | Desc: "The collection of states or qualities attributed to all phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་དེ [Type: State | Desc: "The quality of emptiness attributed to all phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མཚན་ཉིད་མེད་པ [Type: State | Desc: "The quality of being without characteristics attributed to all phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མ་སྐྱེས་པ [Type: State | Desc: "The quality of being unborn attributed to all phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ​མ་འགགས་པ [Type: State | Desc: "The quality of being unceased attributed to all phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དྲི་མ་མེད་པ [Type: State | Desc: "The quality of being stainless attributed to all phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དྲི་མ་དང་བྲལ་བ་མེད་པ [Type: State | Desc: "The quality of not being free from stains attributed to all phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ​བྲི་བ་མེད་པ [Type: State | Desc: "The quality of not diminishing attributed to all phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གང་བ་མེད་པའོ [Type: State | Desc: "The quality of not filling attributed to all phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
word_by_word:
- ​ཤཱ་རིའི་བུ་ : Shariputra [Vocative address; Name of Buddha's disciple; functions as the direct addressee of this teaching]
- དེ་ལྟ་བས་ན་ : therefore [Conjunction formed from `དེ་ལྟ་བས་` (due to that) + `ན་` (then); introduces a conclusion based on previous discourse; serves as linker connecting this statement to prior context]
- ཆོས་ : phenomena [Nominal form of `ཆོས་`; dharma, phenomena, teachings; here referring to all experiential phenomena; functions as the central topic being described]
- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Quantifier modifying `ཆོས་`; every, complete, total; emphasizes the universal scope of the statement about phenomena; completes the participant-center phrase]
- སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་ : emptiness [Nominal form; `སྟོང་པ་` (empty) + `ཉིད་` (ness/essence); technical term referring to the ultimate nature lacking inherent existence; the primary quality attributed to phenomena]
- དེ། : are [Connective particle; links the subject to its predicates; represents the implied process connecting phenomena with their qualities]
- མཚན་ཉིད་མེད་པ། : without characteristics [Negated attribute; `མཚན་ཉིད་` (characteristic, defining mark) + `མེད་པ་` (without); indicates phenomena lack fixed, definable qualities; one of the states attributed to phenomena]
- མ་སྐྱེས་པ། : unborn [Negated verb as attribute; `མ་` (negation) + `སྐྱེས་པ་` (born, arisen); indicates phenomena have no true origination; one of the states attributed to phenomena]
- ​མ་འགགས་པ། : unceased [Negated verb as attribute; `མ་` (negation) + `འགགས་པ་` (ceased, stopped); indicates phenomena have no true cessation; one of the states attributed to phenomena]
- དྲི་མ་མེད་པ། : stainless [Negated attribute; `དྲི་མ་` (stain, impurity) + `མེད་པ་` (without); indicates phenomena are inherently pure; one of the states attributed to phenomena]
- དྲི་མ་དང་བྲལ་བ་མེད་པ། : not free from stains [Complex negated attribute; `དྲི་མ་` (stain) + `དང་` (and) + `བྲལ་བ་` (free from) + `མེད་པ་` (without); indicates phenomena neither have stains nor are free from stains; transcends dualistic concepts]
- ​བྲི་བ་མེད་པ། : not diminishing [Negated attribute; `བྲི་བ་` (diminish, decrease) + `མེད་པ་` (without); indicates phenomena neither increase nor decrease; one of the states attributed to phenomena]
- གང་བ་མེད་པའོ། : not filling [Negated attribute + sentence-final marker; `གང་བ་` (filling, increasing) + `མེད་པ་` (without) + `འོ` (final particle); indicates phenomena are neither full nor empty; completes the list of attributes]

source: ​ཤཱ་རིའི་བུ་དེ་ལྟ་བས་ན་སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་ལ་གཟུགས་མེད། ཚོར་བ་མེད། ​འདུ་ཤེས་མེད། འདུ་བྱེད་མེད། རྣམ་པར་ཤེས་པ་མེད། མིག་མེད། རྣ་བ་མེད། སྣ་མེད། ལྕེ་མེད། ལུས་མེད། ཡིད་མེད །གཟུགས་མེད། སྒྲ་མེད། དྲི་མེད། རོ་མེད། རེག་བྱ་མེད། ཆོས་མེད་དོ། །

word_by_word:
- ཤཱ་རིའི་བུ : Shariputra [Vocative form; Shariputra, a chief disciple of Buddha; functions as the recipient of this teaching in the discourse structure]
- དེ་ལྟ་བས་ན : therefore [Connective phrase; lit. "by looking at it thus"; serves as a logical connector linking this statement to preceding context]
- སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་ལ : in emptiness [Locative case of `སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་`: emptiness, śūnyatā; the central philosophical concept being elaborated in this passage]
- གཟུགས་མེད : there is no form [Negation of `གཟུགས་`: material form, rūpa; the first of the five skandhas/aggregates being negated]
- ཚོར་བ་མེད : there is no feeling [Negation of `ཚོར་བ`: sensation, vedanā; the second of the five skandhas being negated]
- འདུ་ཤེས་མེད : there is no perception [Negation of `འདུ་ཤེས`: recognition, saṃjñā; the third of the five skandhas being negated]
- འདུ་བྱེད་མེད : there are no formations [Negation of `འདུ་བྱེད`: mental formations, saṃskāra; the fourth of the five skandhas being negated]
- རྣམ་པར་ཤེས་པ་མེད : there is no consciousness [Negation of `རྣམ་པར་ཤེས་པ`: consciousness, vijñāna; the fifth of the five skandhas being negated]
- མིག་མེད : there is no eye [Negation of `མིག`: eye; the first of the six sense bases (āyatana) being negated]
- རྣ་བ་མེད : there is no ear [Negation of `རྣ་བ`: ear; the second of the six sense bases being negated]
- སྣ་མེད : there is no nose [Negation of `སྣ`: nose; the third of the six sense bases being negated]
- ལྕེ་མེད : there is no tongue [Negation of `ལྕེ`: tongue; the fourth of the six sense bases being negated]
- ལུས་མེད : there is no body [Negation of `ལུས`: body; the fifth of the six sense bases being negated]
- ཡིད་མེད : there is no mind [Negation of `ཡིད`: mind; the sixth of the six sense bases being negated]
- གཟུགས་མེད : there is no visible form [Negation of `གཟུགས`: visible form; the first of the six sense objects being negated, distinct from the first skandha]
- སྒྲ་མེད : there is no sound [Negation of `སྒྲ`: sound; the second of the six sense objects being negated]
- དྲི་མེད : there is no smell [Negation of `དྲི`: smell, odor; the third of the six sense objects being negated]
- རོ་མེད : there is no taste [Negation of `རོ`: taste; the fourth of the six sense objects being negated]
- རེག་བྱ་མེད : there is no tangible object [Negation of `རེག་བྱ`: tactile sensation; the fifth of the six sense objects being negated]
- ཆོས་མེད་དོ : there is no mental phenomenon [Final emphatic negation of `ཆོས`: dharma, mental objects; the sixth of the six sense objects being negated; concludes the entire enumeration with the final particle `དོ`]

    ├── ​མིག་གི་ཁམས་མེད་པ་ནས་ཡིད་ཀྱི་ཁམས་མེད [Type: Scene | Desc: "First negation statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མིག་གི་ཁམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The first element being negated" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མེད་པ [Type: State | Desc: "Negation of the eye realm" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ནས [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector indicating range from first to second element" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡིད་ཀྱི་ཁམས་མེད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The second negated element" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡིད་ཀྱི་ཁམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The mind realm" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མེད [Type: State | Desc: "Negation of the mind realm" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཡིད་ཀྱི་རྣམ་པར་ཤེས་པའི་ཁམས་ཀྱི་བར་དུ་ཡང་མེད་དོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Final negation statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཡིད་ཀྱི་རྣམ་པར་ཤེས་པའི་ཁམས་ཀྱི་བར་དུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Complete phrase indicating the extent of the third negated element" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡང་མེད་དོ [Type: State | Desc: "Negation of the third element" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector indicating addition to previous negations" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མེད་དོ [Type: State | Desc: "Final negation marker" | Implicit: ""]
word_by_word:
- མིག་གི་ : of the eye [Genitive case marker གི་ connecting མིག་ (eye) to ཁམས་; indicates possession; functions as a modifier of the subsequent element]
- ཁམས་ : realm/element [Noun: dhātu, element, realm; in Buddhist philosophy refers to the sensory domains or elements that constitute experience; functions as Patient in the semantic structure]
- མེད་པ་ : non-existence [Negative existential verb མེད་ with nominalizer པ་; indicates the absence of the eye realm; functions as the core State predicate]
- ནས་ : from [Ablative case marker; indicates the starting point of a range "from X to Y"; functions as a Linker connecting the first negation to the second]
- ཡིད་ཀྱི་ : of the mind [Genitive case marker ཀྱི་ connecting ཡིད་ (mind) to ཁམས་; indicates possession; functions as a modifier]
- ཁམས་ : realm/element [Noun: dhātu, element, realm; refers to the mental domain; functions as Patient in the semantic structure]
- མེད། : does not exist [Negative existential verb; negates the existence of the mind realm; functions as the State predicate]
- ཡིད་ཀྱི་ : of the mind [Genitive case marker ཀྱི་ connecting ཡིད་ (mind) to the following phrase; indicates possession; functions as a modifier]
- རྣམ་པར་ : completely [Adverbial form of རྣམ་པ་ (aspect, form); here intensifies the following term; indicates complete or thorough awareness]
- ཤེས་པའི་ : of consciousness [Genitive form of ཤེས་པ་ (to know, consciousness); links consciousness to ཁམས་; functions as a modifier]
- ཁམས་ཀྱི་ : of the realm [Genitive case marker ཀྱི་ connecting ཁམས་ (realm) to བར་; indicates possession; functions as a modifier]
- བར་དུ་ : up to [Terminative case marker; indicates the endpoint of a range "up to/including"; functions as part of a compound Patient expression]
- ཡང་ : also/even [Emphatic particle; adds emphasis and connects this negation to previous ones; functions as a Linker that adds this negation to the prior ones]
- མེད་དོ། : does not exist [Negative existential verb མེད་ with the final particle དོ་; provides emphatic negation and marks end of statement; functions as the final State predicate]

source: ​མ་རིག་པ་མེད། ​མ་རིག་པ་ཟད་པ་མེད་པ་ནས་རྒ་ཤི་མེད། ​རྒ་ཤི་ཟད་པའི་བར་དུ་ཡང་མེད་དོ། ། སྡུག་བསྔལ་བ་དང་། ཀུན་འབྱུང་བ་དང་། འགོག་པ་དང་། ལམ་མེད། ཡེ་ཤེས་མེད། ཐོབ་པ་མེད། མ་ཐོབ་པ་ཡང་མེད་དོ། །

​མ་རིག་པ་མེད། ​མ་རིག་པ་ཟད་པ་མེད་པ་ནས་རྒ་ཤི་མེད། ​རྒ་ཤི་ཟད་པའི་བར་དུ་ཡང་མེད་དོ། ། སྡུག་བསྔལ་བ་དང་། ཀུན་འབྱུང་བ་དང་། འགོག་པ་དང་། ལམ་མེད། ཡེ་ཤེས་མེད། ཐོབ་པ་མེད། མ་ཐོབ་པ་ཡང་མེད་དོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing parallel negation scenes" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── ​མ་རིག་པ་ཟད་པ་མེད་པ་ནས་རྒ་ཤི་མེད [Type: Negated State | Desc: "Negation of the range from cessation of ignorance to aging and death" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ​མ་རིག་པ་ཟད་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Cessation of ignorance as patient" | Implicit: ""]

        └── ​རྒ་ཤི་ཟད་པའི་བར་དུ་ཡང་མེད་དོ [Type: Negated State | Desc: "Negation extending to cessation of aging and death" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རྒ་ཤི་ཟད་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Cessation of aging and death as patient" | Implicit: ""]

        └── མ་ཐོབ་པ་ཡང་མེད་དོ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Non-attainment as patient of negation" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Linker indicating addition" | Implicit: ""]
word_by_word:
- མ་རིག་པ་ : ignorance [negation prefix `མ་` + `རིག་པ་` (knowledge, awareness); refers to fundamental ignorance or delusion about reality; functions as the Patient of negation in the semantic structure]
- མེད : there is no [negative existential verb; negates the existence of `མ་རིག་པ་` (ignorance); serves as the main predicate in the negation structure]
- མ་རིག་པ་ཟད་པ་ : cessation of ignorance [`མ་རིག་པ་` (ignorance) + `ཟད་པ་` (exhaustion, cessation); refers to the ending of fundamental ignorance; functions as Patient in the semantic structure]
- མེད་པ་ : is not [negative existential verb in attributive form; negates the existence of `མ་རིག་པ་ཟད་པ་` (cessation of ignorance)]
- ནས : from [ablative particle indicating the starting point of a range; links the cessation of ignorance to aging and death in a continuous sequence]
- རྒ་ཤི : aging and death [compound of `རྒ་` (aging) + `ཤི` (death); refers to the final link in the twelve links of dependent origination; functions as Patient of negation]
- མེད : there is no [negative existential verb; negates the existence of `རྒ་ཤི` (aging and death)]
- རྒ་ཤི་ཟད་པའི་ : cessation of aging and death [`རྒ་ཤི` (aging and death) + `ཟད་པ་` (cessation) + genitive particle `འི་`; the ending of the final link in dependent origination; functions as Patient in the semantic structure]
- བར་དུ : up to [terminative particle indicating the endpoint of a range; marks the extent of what is being negated]
- ཡང་ : also [emphatic particle indicating addition; adds emphasis that even this is negated]
- མེད་དོ : there is not [negative existential verb + final particle `དོ`; completes the negation with finality]
- སྡུག་བསྔལ་བ་ : suffering [nominalizer `བ་` added to `སྡུག་བསྔལ་` (suffering, pain); refers to the First Noble Truth; functions as Patient of negation]
- དང་ : and [conjunction linking items in a list; connects the Four Noble Truths in sequence]
- ཀུན་འབྱུང་བ་ : origin [literal: `ཀུན་` (all) + `འབྱུང་བ་` (arising); refers to the Second Noble Truth, the origin of suffering; functions as Patient of negation]
- དང་ : and [conjunction linking items in a list; connects the Four Noble Truths in sequence]
- འགོག་པ་ : cessation [nominalizer `པ་` added to `འགོག་` (to cease); refers to the Third Noble Truth, the cessation of suffering; functions as Patient of negation]
- དང་ : and [conjunction linking items in a list; connects the Four Noble Truths in sequence]
- ལམ : path [refers to the Fourth Noble Truth, the path leading to cessation of suffering; functions as Patient of negation]
- མེད : there is no [negative existential verb; negates the existence of the Four Noble Truths]
- ཡེ་ཤེས་ : wisdom [primordial or transcendental wisdom; understood as perfect knowledge beyond conceptual understanding; functions as Patient of negation]
- མེད : there is no [negative existential verb; negates the existence of `ཡེ་ཤེས་` (wisdom)]
- ཐོབ་པ་ : attainment [nominalizer `པ་` added to `ཐོབ་` (to obtain, attain); refers to spiritual achievement or realization; functions as Patient of negation]
- མེད : there is no [negative existential verb; negates the existence of `ཐོབ་པ་` (attainment)]
- མ་ཐོབ་པ་ : non-attainment [negation prefix `མ་` + `ཐོབ་པ་` (attainment); refers to the absence of attainment; functions as Patient of negation]
- ཡང་ : also [emphatic particle indicating addition; adds emphasis that even this concept is negated]
- མེད་དོ : there is not [negative existential verb + final particle `དོ`; completes the negation with finality]

ucca_formatted:
​ཤཱ་རིའི་བུ་དེ་ལྟ་བས་ན་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་རྣམས་ཐོབ་པ་མེད་པའི་ཕྱིར། ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ལ་བརྟེན་ཅིང ་གནས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ​ཤཱ་རིའི་བུ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person being addressed (Shariputra)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ལྟ་བས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector indicating logical consequence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་རྣམས་ཐོབ་པ་མེད་པའི་ཕྱིར [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the bodhisattvas' state of non-attainment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་རྣམས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The bodhisattvas who are in the state of non-attainment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཐོབ་པ་མེད་པ [Type: Process-State | Desc: "The dynamic state of non-attainment experienced by the bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཕྱིར [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relator indicating causality" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ལ་བརྟེན་ཅིང ་གནས་ཏེ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the bodhisattvas dwelling in reliance on the perfection of wisdom as a result of their non-attainment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་རྣམས] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agent, referring to the bodhisattvas mentioned in node 3.1" | Implicit: "Implicit reference to the bodhisattvas mentioned in node 3.1"]
        ├── བརྟེན་ཅིང ་གནས་ཏེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of dwelling in reliance performed by the bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [སེམས་ཀྱི་སྒྲིབ་པ་མེད་པར] [Type: Elaborator-Manner | Desc: "Implicit elaborator indicating the manner of dwelling - without mental obstruction" | Implicit: "Implied manner of dwelling"]
        └── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ལ [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The object that the bodhisattvas rely upon" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [ཕྱིར] [Type: Relator | Desc: "Implicit relator connecting the two scenes in a causal relationship" | Implicit: "Implicit relator connecting the causal scenes"]
word_by_word:
- ཤཱ་རིའི་བུ། : Shariputra [Vocative form used to address Shariputra, the primary disciple of Buddha being addressed; functions as the recipient of this teaching]

- དེ་ལྟ་བས་ན། : therefore [Connecting phrase meaning "that being so" or "for that reason"; acts as a linker indicating logical consequence between previous statements and what follows]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattvas [Nominative plural of `བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་`: those who aspire to enlightenment for the benefit of all beings; functioning as the primary agents in this passage]

- རྣམས། : plural marker [Grammatical particle indicating plurality; modifies bodhisattvas to indicate multiple beings]

- ཐོབ་པ་ : attainment [Nominalizer of `ཐོབ་`: to obtain, achieve, attain; here referring to the concept of attainment or achievement]

- མེད་པའི་ : without [Genitive form of `མེད་པ་`: non-existence or absence; here indicating the state of non-attainment that characterizes the bodhisattvas]

- ཕྱིར། : because [Causal connector indicating reason or purpose; links the bodhisattvas' non-attainment with their reliance on the perfection of wisdom]

- ཤེས་རབ་ : wisdom [From Sanskrit prajñā; refers to transcendent wisdom or insight that comprehends the true nature of reality]

- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle connecting "wisdom" to "perfection"; indicates possession or relationship]

- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : other shore [Metaphorical term referring to transcendence or reaching the "far shore"; part of the compound term for "perfection"]

- ཕྱིན་པ་ : perfection [From Sanskrit pāramitā; literally "gone beyond"; completes the compound term for the perfection of wisdom]

- ལ། : on [Allative/locative particle indicating the object of reliance; links the perfection of wisdom to the verbs of relying and dwelling]

- བརྟེན་ : rely [Past/perfect form of `རྟེན་`: to depend on or rely upon; indicates the bodhisattvas' action of taking refuge in or depending on the perfection of wisdom]

- ཅིང་ : and [Connective particle joining two verbal phrases; links "relying" with "dwelling"]

- གནས་ཏེ། : dwell [Present form of `གནས་`: to abide, stay, or dwell, followed by the continuative particle `ཏེ་`; indicates the ongoing state of abiding in the perfection of wisdom without mental obstructions]

སེམས་ལ་སྒྲིབ་པ་མེད་པས་སྐྲག་པ་མེད་དེ། ཕྱིན་ཅི་ལོག་ལས་ཤིན་ཏུ་འདས་ནས་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་མཐར་ཕྱིན་ཏོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing parallel scenes describing the state of mind and attainment of nirvana" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས་ལ་སྒྲིབ་པ་མེད་པས་སྐྲག་པ་མེད་དེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing the state of fearlessness due to lack of obscurations" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྒྲིབ་པ་མེད་པས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Causal adverbial providing the reason for the main state" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྒྲིབ་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The obscurations that are absent" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མེད་པས [Type: State | Desc: "State of non-existence with causal marker" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ལ [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "Location where obscurations are absent" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སྐྲག་པ་མེད་དེ [Type: State | Desc: "Main state of fearlessness" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྐྲག་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The fear that is absent" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མེད་དེ [Type: State | Desc: "State of non-existence with connective marker" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Punctuation linking two scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཕྱིན་ཅི་ལོག་ལས་ཤིན་ཏུ་འདས་ནས་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་མཐར་ཕྱིན་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing the attainment of nirvana" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཕྱིན་ཅི་ལོག་ལས་ཤིན་ཏུ་འདས་ནས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial describing the prior action of transcending delusions" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཕྱིན་ཅི་ལོག་ལས [Type: Participant-Source | Desc: "Source from which one transcends" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདས [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of transcending" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཤིན་ཏུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial intensifying the transcendence" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [the practitioner] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The explicit agent who attains nirvana" | Implicit: "the practitioner"]
        └── མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་མཐར་ཕྱིན་ཏོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of ultimately attaining nirvana" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མྱ་ངན་ལས [Type: Participant-Source | Desc: "The source state (suffering) from which one transcends" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདས་པར [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The goal state of nirvana" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མཐར་ཕྱིན [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of ultimately reaching or attaining" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཏོ [Type: Function-Completive | Desc: "Sentence-final particle indicating completion" | Implicit: ""]
word_by_word:
- སེམས་ལ་ : in the mind [Locative case of `སེམས་`: mind; indicating where the obscurations are absent; functions as Participant-Location in semantic structure]
- སྒྲིབ་པ་ : obscurations [Nominative of `སྒྲིབ་པ་`: obscuration, veil; referring to mental obscurations that block enlightenment; functions as Participant-Patient]
- མེད་པས་ : because there are none [Causal form of `མེད་`: to not exist; root meaning is non-existence with causal implication "because"; functions as causal connector]
- སྐྲག་པ་ : fear [Nominative of `སྐྲག་པ་`: fear, terror; the emotional response that is absent; functions as Participant-Patient]
- མེད་དེ་ : there is none [Connective form of `མེད་`: to not exist; indicates absence of fear and connects to following clause; functions as main state predicate with connective function]
- ཕྱིན་ཅི་ལོག་ : delusion [Nominative of `ཕྱིན་ཅི་ལོག་`: wrong view, delusion, misconception; referring to fundamental misapprehension of reality; functions as Source from which one transcends]
- ལས་ : from [Ablative particle indicating movement away from delusion; functions as Source marker]
- ཤིན་ཏུ་ : completely [Adverb intensifying the transcendence; indicates thoroughness of transcendence; functions as Adverbial intensifier]
- འདས་ནས་ : having transcended [Terminative form of `འདས་`: to go beyond, transcend; indicates completed action prior to the main verb; functions as Process]
- མྱ་ངན་ : suffering [Nominative of `མྱ་ངན་`: sorrow, misery; referring to samsaric suffering; functions as part of Source]
- ལས་ : from [Ablative particle indicating movement away from suffering; functions as Source marker]
- འདས་པར་ : to the state beyond [Terminative form of `འདས་པ་`: beyond, transcended; indicates the goal state of nirvana; functions as Participant-Goal]
- མཐར་ཕྱིན་ : completely attained [Compound of `མཐར་`: to the end and `ཕྱིན་`: to reach, arrive; indicates complete fulfillment; functions as main Process]
- ཏོ་ : (final particle) [Sentence-final particle indicating completion and certainty; functions as completive marker]

word_by_word:
- དུས་གསུམ་ : three times [Compound of `དུས་` (time) and `གསུམ་` (three); refers to past, present, and future; functions as temporal specification in the UCCA structure]
- དུ་ : in [Locative/temporal particle; indicates location in time; connects the "three times" to the buddhas' dwelling]
- རྣམ་པར་ : manifestly [Adverbial form from `རྣམ་པ་` (manner, way); indicates comprehensive or complete manner; modifies "dwelling"]
- བཞུགས་པའི་ : who dwell [Genitive form of `བཞུགས་པ་` (honorific verb for "to sit, dwell, reside"); denotes the state or condition of the buddhas; connects their existence to the three times]
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : buddhas [Compound of `སངས་` (purified/awakened) and `རྒྱས་` (developed/expanded); refers to fully enlightened beings; functions as the main agent in the sentence]
- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Universal quantifier; modifies "buddhas" to indicate totality; part of the agent phrase]
- ཀྱང་ : also/even [Emphatic particle; highlights the universality of the statement; reinforces that this applies to all buddhas without exception]
- ཤེས་རབ་ : wisdom [Compound of `ཤེས་` (to know) and `རབ་` (supreme); refers to transcendent insight or discriminating awareness; part of the instrumental phrase]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; connects "wisdom" to "perfection"; establishes possessive relationship]
- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : to the other shore [Compound of `ཕ་རོལ་` (far side/other shore) and locative particle `ཏུ་`; metaphor for transcendence; part of the compound term for "perfection"]
- ཕྱིན་པ་ : perfection/having gone [Verbal noun from `ཕྱིན་` (to go/reach); together with previous term forms "pāramitā" or perfection; functions as the instrumental means]
- ལ་ : on/to [Allative/dative particle; indicates relationship between "relying" and "perfection of wisdom"; connects means to process]
- བརྟེན་ནས་ : by relying [Instrumental form of `རྟེན་` (to rely/depend); indicates method or means; shows how buddhas achieved enlightenment]
- བླ་ན་ : above [Compound of `བླ་` (above) and `ན་` (locative); part of compound meaning "unsurpassed"]
- མེད་པ་ : without [Negative form of `ཡོད་པ་` (to exist); combined with previous term means "unsurpassed"; qualifies the enlightenment]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : authentic/perfectly [Adverbial form of `ཡང་དག་པ་` (authentic, genuine, right); indicates quality of completeness; modifies "complete"]
- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive form of `རྫོགས་པ་` (to complete/perfect); indicates the perfected nature; qualifies "enlightenment"]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Compound of `བྱང་` (purified) and `ཆུབ་` (perfected); Sanskrit "bodhi"; the goal state being attained]
- ཏུ་ : into/as [Terminative particle; indicates transformation or becoming; connects the goal to the process]
- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [Adverbial form of `མངོན་པ་` (evident, manifest); indicates clear, evident manner; modifies "became completely awakened"]
- རྫོགས་པར་ : completely [Adverbial form of `རྫོགས་པ་` (to complete); indicates thoroughness; modifies "awakened"]
- སངས་རྒྱས་སོ : became fully awakened [Verbal form of `སངས་རྒྱས་` with final particle `སོ་`; indicates completion of action; the main process of the sentence]

        ├── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པའི་སྔགས། རིག་པ་ཆེན་པོའི་སྔགས། བླ་ན་མེད་པའི་སྔགས། མི་མཉམ་པ་དང་མཉམ་པའི་སྔགས། སྡུག་བསྔལ་ཐམས་ཅད་རབ་ཏུ་ཞི་བར་བྱེད་པའི་སྔགས། [Type: Center | Desc: "The main entity (mantra) being described" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པའི་སྔགས། [Type: Elaborator-Attribute | Desc: "First attribute of the mantra" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རིག་པ་ཆེན་པོའི་སྔགས། [Type: Elaborator-Attribute | Desc: "Second attribute of the mantra" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བླ་ན་མེད་པའི་སྔགས། [Type: Elaborator-Attribute | Desc: "Third attribute of the mantra" | Implicit: ""]

            └── སྡུག་བསྔལ་ཐམས་ཅད་རབ་ཏུ་ཞི་བར་བྱེད་པའི་སྔགས། [Type: Elaborator-Attribute | Desc: "Fifth attribute of the mantra" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་རྫུན་པས་ན [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial phrase giving the reason for the truth of the mantra" | Implicit: ""]

word_by_word:
- དེ་ལྟ་བས་ན་ : Therefore [Adverbial phrase from `དེ་ལྟ་བ་`: 'in that way', 'thus'; functions as a temporal context marker that introduces the main content; serves as a logical connector]

- ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ : of transcendent wisdom [Genitive case of `ཤེས་རབ་`: wisdom, prajna; specifically refers to the highest form of discriminating wisdom; functions as part of a compound descriptor]

- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : to the other shore [Terminative case of `ཕ་རོལ་`: opposite shore, far side; metaphorically indicates complete transcendence; part of the perfection terminology]

- ཕྱིན་པའི་ : perfection [Genitive of `ཕྱིན་པ་`: gone beyond, reached, perfected; completed process of going beyond; forms part of the term prajnaparamita]

- སྔགས། : mantra [Noun; sacred verbal formula; first occurrence as the object being described; the central entity of five parallel attributes]

- རིག་པ་ : awareness [Noun; cognition, knowledge; refers to primordial awareness or gnosis; functions as part of second attribute]

- ཆེན་པོའི་ : great [Genitive of `ཆེན་པོ་`: great, vast; indicates the expansive nature of the awareness; qualifier of `རིག་པ་`]

- སྔགས། : mantra [Noun; second occurrence; object being described in the second attribute]

- བླ་ན་ : above [Locative of `བླ་`: above, superior; in this context indicating a comparative position; part of a negative construction]

- མེད་པའི་ : without [Genitive of `མེད་པ་`: non-existence, absence; negates `བླ་ན་`; creates the meaning "unsurpassed"]

- སྔགས། : mantra [Noun; third occurrence; object being described in the third attribute]

- མི་མཉམ་པ་ : incomparable [Negative form of `མཉམ་པ་`: equal, same; with negative prefix `མི་`; indicates uniqueness]

- དང་ : and [Conjunction; connects two related but contrasting qualities]

- མཉམ་པའི་ : equal to [Genitive of `མཉམ་པ་`: equal, equivalent; indicates a paradoxical quality; links to the preceding term]

- སྔགས། : mantra [Noun; fourth occurrence; object being described in the fourth attribute]

- སྡུག་བསྔལ་ : suffering [Noun; duḥkha; all forms of dissatisfaction and pain; functions as the object affected by the mantra]

- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Adjective; entirety, without exception; modifies `སྡུག་བསྔལ་`; emphasizes the comprehensive scope]

- རབ་ཏུ་ : completely [Adverb; intensifier prefix meaning thoroughly, utterly; modifies the action of pacifying]

- ཞི་བར་ : pacifying [Terminative case of `ཞི་བ་`: peace, calm, cessation; indicates the state of complete pacification]

- བྱེད་པའི་ : which does [Genitive of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, make; indicates agency or function; links the action to the mantra]

- སྔགས། : mantra [Noun; fifth occurrence; object being described in the fifth attribute]

- མི་རྫུན་པས་ན་ : because it is not false [Causal construction: `མི་`: negative prefix + `རྫུན་པ་`: false, untrue + `ས་ན་`: causal connector; gives reason for the truth claim; functions as an adverbial phrase]

- བདེན་པར་ : as true [Terminative of `བདེན་པ་`: truth, reality; indicates the goal or result of knowledge; what the mantra should be recognized as]

- ཤེས་པར་ : to be known [Terminative of `ཤེས་པ་`: to know, understand; main action of recognizing or understanding the mantra]

- བྱ་སྟེ། : should be done [Auxiliary verb construction: `བྱ་`: do, make (future form) + `སྟེ་`: connective particle; indicating obligation and continuation]

- ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པའི་ : of the perfection of wisdom [Compound phrase in genitive case; repeated from earlier; specifies the type of mantra being referred to]

- སྔགས་ : mantra [Noun; central entity being uttered; object of the following verb]

- སྨྲས་པ། : was spoken [Past tense of `སྨྲ་བ་`: to speak, utter; main process verb; indicates the action of pronouncing the mantra; agent is implicit]

word_by_word:
- ཏདྱ་ཐཱ། : Thus [Sanskrit term introducing a mantra; literally "in this way" or "as follows"; functions as an opening formula that introduces the mantra sequence]

- ག་ཏེ་ : gone [Sanskrit term in Tibetan script; first occurrence of 'gate'; represents the first step in the spiritual journey; indicates movement beyond ordinary experience]

- ག་ཏེ་ : gone [Sanskrit term in Tibetan script; second occurrence of 'gate'; repetition emphasizes the continued progression beyond ordinary experience; reinforces the transformative nature of the spiritual journey]

- པཱ་ར་ག་ཏེ། : gone beyond [Sanskrit term in Tibetan script; 'pāragate'; indicates transcendence of duality; represents crossing to the other shore of existence beyond conceptual limitations]

- པཱ་ར་སཾ་ག་ཏེ། : gone completely beyond [Sanskrit term in Tibetan script; 'pārasaṃgate'; indicates complete transcendence; represents the perfection of wisdom where all dualistic concepts are fully transcended]

- བོ་དྷི་ : awakening [Sanskrit term in Tibetan script; 'bodhi'; refers to enlightenment or awakening; represents the culmination of the spiritual journey and the realization of emptiness]

- སྭ་ཧཱ། : so be it [Sanskrit term in Tibetan script; 'svāhā'; traditional Sanskrit mantra ending; functions as a consecration or blessing that marks the auspicious completion of the mantra]

- བསླབ་པར་ : train [Verbal noun from `སློབ་པ་`: to learn, train; indicates the main Process to be undertaken]

- དེ་ནས་ : Then [Temporal adverb; links to previous context; functions as a temporal connector in the narrative sequence]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound noun from `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); primary agent performing the action of arising]
- ཏིང་ངེ་འཛིན་ : meditation [Noun; refers to deep meditative concentration or samādhi; source location in this context]
- དེ་ལས་ : from that [Demonstrative pronoun `དེ་` with ablative case marker `ལས་`; indicates movement from a source; specifies which meditation]
- བཞེངས་ཏེ། : arose and [Verb `བཞེངས་` (honorific for "to rise") with connective particle `ཏེ་`; indicates completion of one action before another begins; main process of the first scene]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : Bodhisattva [Compound noun; one who aspires to enlightenment; identifies Avalokiteshvara in this context]
- སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོས་ : the great being [Compound noun with agentive case marker `ས་`; honorific description of Avalokiteshvara; clarifies the status of the recipient]
- འཕགས་པ་ : noble [Honorific prefix; modifies Avalokiteshvara; indicates elevated spiritual status]
- སྤྱན་རས་དབང་ཕྱུག་ : Avalokiteshvara [Proper name of the bodhisattva; recipient of Buddha's approval; literally "Lord who looks with compassionate eyes"]
- ལ་ : to [Dative case marker; indicates recipient of action; marks Avalokiteshvara as the recipient]
- ལེགས་སོ་ : "Well done!" [Expression of approval; content of Buddha's praise; functions as the patient/object of giving]
- ཞེས་ : called, saying [Quotative particle; marks the end of quoted speech; links speech content to speech act]
- བྱ་བ་ : that which is called [Verbal noun from `བྱ་` (to call, name); refers to the statement of approval]
- བྱིན་ནས། : having given [Verb `བྱིན་` (to give) with connective particle `ནས་`; indicates the Buddha bestowed approval before continuing]
- ལེགས་སོ་ལེགས་སོ། : "Well done! Well done!" [Repeated expression of approval; emphasis through repetition; direct speech from Buddha]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་ : son of noble family [Term of address for disciples; genitive construction (`ཀྱི་`) connecting `རིགས་` (family/lineage) with `བུ་` (son); identifies the recipient of Buddha's continued speech]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to what was previously discussed or demonstrated]
- དེ་བཞིན་ནོ། : is thus [Demonstrative `དེ་` with `བཞིན་` (like, similar to) and final particle `ནོ་`; statement of affirmation; confirms the truth of what was said]

- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་: Child of noble family [Vocative; from `རིགས་`: lineage/family + `ཀྱི་`: genitive particle + `བུ་`: son/child; functions as Recipient in the discourse, directly addressed by the speaker]

- དེ་: that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to what was previously discussed]

- དེ་བཞིན་: likewise/in that way [Adverbial compound; from `དེ་`: that + `བཞིན་`: like/manner; confirms agreement with a previous statement]

- ཏེ: is [Continuative particle; connects preceding confirmation with following instructions]

- ཇི་ལྟར་: just as [Correlative adverb; introduces a comparison or parallel, setting up the manner]

- ཁྱོད་ཀྱིས་: by you [Agentive/ergative case; from `ཁྱོད་`: you + `ཀྱིས་`: instrumental/agentive particle; indicates the doer of the teaching]

- བསྟན་པ་: taught [Past tense verb/verbal noun; from `སྟོན་པ་`: to show/teach; refers to previous instruction given]

- བཞིན་དུ་: in accordance with [Postpositional phrase; from `བཞིན་`: manner/like + `དུ་`: terminative particle; indicates conformity with the teaching]

- ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་: of wisdom [Genitive phrase; from `ཤེས་རབ་`: wisdom + `ཀྱི་`: genitive particle; modifies the following perfection]

- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་: perfection/pāramitā [Buddhist technical term; literally "gone to the other shore"; refers to transcendent spiritual practice]

- ཟབ་མོ་: profound [Attributive adjective; describes the perfection of wisdom as deep/profound]

- ལ་: in/toward [Allative particle; indicates direction or object toward which action is directed]

- སྤྱད་པར་: practice [Verbal noun with terminative particle; from `སྤྱོད་པ་`: to practice/engage in]

- བྱ་: should do [Modal auxiliary verb; indicates necessity or obligation]

- སྟེ: and/so [Continuative particle; typically indicates further discourse will follow]

- དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus, in this way [Adverbial phrase where `དེ་`: that, `སྐད་`: speech/words, `ཅེས་`: quotative marker; functioning as an Elaborator indicating the manner of speaking; refers to previous speech content]

- བཀའ་ : speech, teaching [Honorific term for the words or teachings of the Buddha; root word meaning authoritative speech; functions as the content of the Process]

- སྩལ་ : proclaimed, taught [Past tense verb of `སྩོལ་བ་`: to give, bestow, proclaim (honorific); the Process of the Buddha's action of speaking; carries connotation of bestowing teachings]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་ : mahasattva [great being; from `སེམས་དཔའ་`: hero/warrior of mind + `ཆེན་པོ་`: great; an advanced bodhisattva; continues as elaborator for Avalokiteshvara]

- འཁོར་དེ་དག་ : that assembly [from `འཁོར་`: retinue/assembly + `དེ་དག་`: those; the gathering of disciples; serves as third main participant]

word_by_word:
- འཕགས་པ་ : Noble [Attributive modifier; from root `འཕགས་པ་`: noble, exalted, superior; describes the elevated status of the text; functions as an Elaborator modifying the wisdom perfection text]

- ཤེས་རབ་ : wisdom [Noun; from root `ཤེས་རབ་`: wisdom, insight, prajñā; refers to transcendent wisdom or insight that perceives the nature of reality; functions as an Elaborator in the title phrase]

- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive case marker; connects "wisdom" with "perfection"; indicates possession or attribution; functions as a connective element]

- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : beyond [Locative/terminative construction; from `ཕ་རོལ་`: other side, beyond + `ཏུ་`: to, toward; indicates transcendence or crossing over; part of the compound term for "perfection"]

- ཕྱིན་པའི་ : perfection [Genitive form of `ཕྱིན་པ་`: to go beyond, to reach, to perfect; together with previous term forms "pāramitā" (perfection); functions as Center in the title phrase]

- སྙིང་པོ་ : heart/essence [Noun; from root `སྙིང་པོ་`: heart, essence, core; refers to the distilled essential teaching; functions as Center in the title phrase]

- རྫོགས་སོ། : is completed [Verbal final form; from root `རྫོགས་`: to complete, finish, perfect + `སོ`: final particle indicating completed statement; indicates the conclusion of the text; functions as Process in the sentence]

- ། ། : [End punctuation marks; double shad indicating the conclusion of a section or text; functions as a structural indicator marking the text's completion]
